In animal species with no preexisting immunity against an infectious agent, a new intrusion of the pathogen may result in high fatalities. Transmission of a new strain of influenza from birds and poultry to humans has resulted in many epidemics (

Moreover, caretakers working at these parks who are infected with influenza, even with mild illness or in recovery, should not work near the animals.
